chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel P McClain

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel P McClain in court.  
Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Samuel P McClain.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Status  Conference. Defense request a resolution hearing. 
Defense advised plea documents to be submitted to the court 24-hours in advance of the hearing. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Parties advised this hearing will be held in person.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Samuel P McClain not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel advises the court he believes the defendant is at CDC and request an adjournment of today's proceedings. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Samuel P McClain not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status Conference. Discussions placed on the record. Defense requested Scheduling Conference date. Case Adjourned in Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel P McClain in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Samuel P McClain in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY ZOOM. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JLB

Cooperate with all juvinile court services.
Not to be in any vehicles that don't belong to defendant.
No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Samuel P McClain in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Samuel P McClain in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.    Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Samuel P McClain not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an initial appearance. Defendant not produced for today's hearing. Defense requested an additional scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Arraignment scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
